description: Smallest positive a(n) such that the number of solutions to a(n)=a(j)+a(k), j<k<n is four or less.
example: 12 is in the sequence since it is 5+7, 4+8, 3+9 and 2+10 but no other sum of two distinct terms.
mathematica: f[s_List, j_Integer] := Block[{cnt, k = s[[-1]] + 1, ss = Plus @@@ Subsets[s, {j}]}, While[ cnt = Count[ss, k]; cnt == 0 || cnt > 4, k++]; Append[s, k]]; Nest[f[#, 2] &, {1, 2}, 70] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Jul 05 2014 *)
author: _Henry Bottomley_, Mar 15 2001
